data_maturity_score.evidence: MS Fabric for ETL, Power BI for reporting, large data environment with thousands of tables suggests defined processes, but reliance on stored procedures indicates legacy systems alongside modern tools

data_maturity_level.evidence: Score of 3 indicates documented processes and modern tools (MS Fabric, Power BI) but still managing legacy components (stored procedures)

maturity_signals.evidence: MS Fabric (cloud-native), modern Microsoft data stack, and explicit AI applications exploration mentioned

scope_creep_score.evidence: Well-defined Data Architect role with clear responsibilities, not trying to combine multiple roles like DE+DS+DevOps

overtime_risk_score.evidence: Remote position with standard benefits, no 'fast-paced' or 'wear many hats' language, but leadership role may have pressure

role_clarity.evidence: Focused Data Architect role with well-defined responsibilities, clear team structure, and specific tech stack

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Low risk overall - well-defined role, remote flexibility, no major red flags, but some concerns about growth opportunities

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: No specific manager or reporting structure mentioned, only that they lead a small team

manager_level_inferred.evidence: No mention of who this role reports to - could be CTO, VP, Director, or Manager level

team_growth_velocity.evidence: Small team structure (Data Engineer + Data Scientist) suggests stable team size, no expansion mentioned

value.team_size: 3 people (Data Architect + Data Engineer + Data Scientist)

team_composition.evidence: Explicitly mentions leading a small team that includes a Data Engineer and Data Scientist

reporting_structure.evidence: No reporting structure mentioned in job description

cross_functional_embedded.evidence: Centralized data team structure mentioned, no indication of embedding with product teams

work_life_balance_score.evidence: Remote work anywhere in US, standard PTO policy, no on-call or overtime mentions, but leadership role may have expectations

growth_opportunities_score.evidence: Small team structure limits growth, no learning budget or conference mentions, but AI integration provides some learning opportunity

tech_culture_score.evidence: Modern Microsoft stack (MS Fabric, Power BI) but limited engineering practices mentioned, focus on maintenance and integration

tech_culture_signals.evidence: No mention of open source, tech blogs, conferences, hackathons, or innovation time

dev_practices_mentioned.evidence: No specific engineering practices like code review, CI/CD, testing, or monitoring mentioned

innovation_signals.evidence: AI applications and partnerships mentioned, suggesting some innovation focus, but primarily integration and maintenance work

tech_debt_awareness.evidence: No mention of modernizing, refactoring, or improving code quality - focus on maintaining existing large MS environment

ai_integration_level.evidence: Explicitly mentions AI applications, indexing, building agents/copilots, and partnering with AI partner for GenAI applications

ml_tools_expected.evidence: Microsoft ecosystem focus suggests use of MS Fabric's AI features and Power BI's AI capabilities for the mentioned AI applications

hiring_urgency.evidence: No immediate start or ASAP language, standard full-time exempt position posting

competition_level.evidence: Remote anywhere US role with competitive salary ($140-170k) for Data Architect level, but specialized Microsoft stack may limit applicant pool

company_stage_inferred.evidence: Large MS environment with thousands of tables and hundreds of stored procedures suggests established company with substantial data infrastructure

hiring_velocity.evidence: Small team structure and specific role suggests replacement hire rather than expansion

team_size_signals.evidence: Explicitly mentions leading a small team of 3 people total

funding_stage_signals.evidence: No funding stage or company size mentioned in job posting

role_creation_type.evidence: Small established team structure suggests this is likely a replacement hire rather than new headcount

strength_details: Transparent compensation range ($140-170k) for Data Architect level
Fully remote work anywhere in the US
Strong AI integration focus with practical GenAI applications
Clear role definition with hands-on technical leadership opportunity
concern_details: Small team structure (3 people) limits growth and collaboration opportunities
No clear reporting structure or manager level specified
Heavy reliance on legacy stored procedures alongside modern tools
No learning budget or career development opportunities mentioned
best_fit_details: Senior data architects with 7+ years experience in Microsoft ecosystem
Engineers seeking hands-on technical leadership without large team management
Professionals interested in AI integration and GenAI applications
probe_details: Ask about reporting structure and who this role collaborates with laterally
Understand plans for team growth and data organization expansion
Discuss strategy for modernizing legacy stored procedures
Get details on AI partner relationship and specific GenAI projects planned
leverage_details: Deep Microsoft ecosystem expertise (MS Fabric, Power BI, ERP integrations) is specialized
Practical AI/GenAI experience beyond conceptual knowledge is explicitly required
Leadership experience in data architecture with hands-on technical skills
summary.overall_assessment: Solid opportunity for experienced Data Architect seeking remote role with AI focus and technical leadership. Competitive salary, clear responsibilities, and GenAI integration provide growth potential. Main trade-offs are small team size, unclear reporting structure, and mix of legacy/modern technologies requiring careful navigation.
